metadata.title: CVE-2020-12415 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: When "%2F" was present in a manifest URL, Firefox's AppCache behavior may have become confused and allowed a manifest to be served from a subdirectory. This could cause the appcache to be used to service requests for the top level directory. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 78.

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1').
